column2: A fortified barrier across the main trade road. While crude, it ensures that no caravan passes without paying the family's "protection" fee. It establishes the Republic's commercial border effectively.

A formal administrative building housing clerks and armed deputies. They meticulously log cargo, enforce tariffs, and confiscate "contraband" to line the family coffers. The gold flows as steadily as the river.

The ultimate expression of law and profit. The High Sheriff, appointed directly by the Doge, operates from this stone command post. It serves as both a vault for massive tax revenues and a prison for those who try to evade the Republic's dues.
Simple barracks housing a company of scouts and rangers. They patrol the immediate perimeter, ensuring the fort cannot be taken by surprise. A necessity for holding hostile territory.
Expanded living quarters and armories capable of supporting a significant standing force. These troops are drilled to defend the trade routes and hold the fort against determined sieges.

A logistical marvel, this complex includes deep granaries, cisterns, and a command center. It can support a massive legion of defenders indefinitely, turning a simple fort into an immovable object in the path of the Republic's enemies.
